The available components suggest building a simple circuit: battery as power source, wires as conductors, and a light bulb as an indicator. Since substance Z is the test material, I must incorporate it into the circuit. The red light bulb will serve as the visual indicator—if it lights up when substance Z is part of the circuit, Z is conductive. 

First, I'll connect the battery to the red light bulb using wires, leaving one wire end free to interact with substance Z. Specifically:
- Connect one wire from the battery cathode to the light bulb.
- Connect another wire from the battery anode to the light bulb.
- The third wire will bridge the gap between the free end of one wire and substance Z, while the free end of the other wire will also connect to Z. If Z is conductive, the circuit completes and the bulb lights up.
